description.en: Farz Aqamhmdi lost his life on 2026-01-03 in Malekshahi. This Kurdish citizen was shot in the head during the Malekshahi protests on Saturday, January 3, 2026, and was hospitalized in the intensive care unit of Khomeini Hospital in Ilam with a low level of consciousness. On the evening of Monday, January 5, 2026, Fars passed away after three days of hospitalization due to the severity of his injuries.

description.en: Aida Aghili, 34 years old and a resident of Tehran, died from a war ammunition shot to the head. According to sources close to the family, her body was identified and found after a period of searching among bodies transferred to Kahrizak. Aida was active on social media. Her last Instagram story, from January 5, showed an AI-generated image of herself embracing Iran; an image that received renewed attention after news of her death was published. Those close to Aida remember her as someone who loved life, nature, dance, and Iran.

description.en: Afshin Meyarkiani, a taekwondo champion and sports coach, lost his life on Thursday, January 8, 2026, in the city of Chalus. According to reports, he was participating in a protest march with his family when he was shot near a local police station. Informed sources state that he was killed after being hit by three bullets. Witnesses reported that the shooting was carried out by law enforcement forces and that Afshin had attempted to help other civilians before being fatally shot.

description.en: Ahmad Abbasi, after being shot on Piroozi Street, managed to reach an alley and gave his phone to someone, saying 'call the last person in my contact list.' By the time his family reached Piroozi Street, Ahmad had lost his life. Due to security conditions and lack of ambulances around Piroozi Street, Ahmad's mother held her son's body in that alley from night until morning to prevent security forces from taking her child's body. However, when Ahmad's body was eventually transferred to Kahrizak Legal Medicine, plainclothes forces seized Ahmad's body and are now demanding one billion tomans as 'bullet fee' to return the body to the family.

description.en: Daniyal Sabzikar, 28 years old, from Ramhormoz in Khuzestan province and of Lur ethnicity, was killed on January 8, 2026 (18 Dey 1403) in Qazvin when shot with war ammunition by suppression forces. According to reports, the bullet struck his head. Daniyal was an automotive electrician who had migrated from Khuzestan to Qazvin about five to six months earlier to build a better life. He was a hardworking young man striving for his future, but his life was ended by suppression forces with a gunshot.

description.en: Ghasem Vakili, an off-road champion and protesting citizen from Qazvin Province, was killed after being shot directly in the head during the crackdown on the national uprising. He was around 40 years old and the father of a young daughter. He was known as a principled, responsible individual actively involved in humanitarian efforts, including relief work following the Kermanshah earthquake.

description.en: Hamed Basiri, 35, from Karaj and father of one child, was fatally shot in the face by government forces on the evening of January 9, 2026, during public protests in Fardis, Karaj. His family refused the authorities' demand to bury him as a Basij member or pay one billion tomans, and after four days, they received the body under restrictions without being allowed to hold a funeral, and it was buried in Eshtehard, Karaj.

description.en: Hamid Arzanloo, father of two young children, was severely injured and fell into a coma on January 8, 2026 (18 Dey 1404) when shot in the head by security forces in the Tehranpars area of Tehran. He died after several days of unconsciousness on January 11, 2026 (21 Dey 1404). His brother Vahid, who had gone to help him, was also targeted and killed. According to sources close to the family, security agencies received 1.5 billion tomans from the family for the return of the two brothers' bodies and forced them to sign a pledge stating the cause of death as 'stroke.' Additionally, the condition for returning the bodies was the family's attendance at a government rally in Enghelab Square.

links.title: Report on Hamid and Vahid Arzanloo's Deaths

description.en: Jalil Doustiari Barahouei, 22, originally from Zahedan and residing in Meybod, was killed on Friday, January 9, 2026, during public protests in the city after being shot in the chest with live ammunition by government forces. He had gone to Meybod for labor work. His body was buried on January 16, 2026, following funeral prayers at Makki Mosque.

description.en: Mahan Qadami, 23, a rap artist and male barber, was killed on the evening of January 9, 2026, during protests in Islamshahr after being shot by security forces. His body was taken to the Legal Medicine Organization and Gheysarieh mortuary, and later buried in section 79, row 19 of Behesht-e Zahra cemetery. Mahan was passionate about his barber work and ran a small shop in the Vavan neighborhood of Islamshahr, sharing videos of his craft on Instagram.

description.en: Masoud Bolourchi, 37, physiotherapist and founder of Rush Clinic in Tehran, was savagely shot in the back of the head by Islamic Republic regime forces during the January 2026 protests (Dey 1404). This cruel act shattered a life brimming with passion for his work and science. His family identified his body in Kahrizak, and after suffering intense threats, pressure, and forced payment, they received it and buried him in silence.

description.en: Mehrab Golestani, a 17-year-old teenager, was killed on Friday, January 9, 2026 (19 Dey 1404) during protests in Isfahan when shot with war ammunition. Mehrab's family is originally from Kerman and resides in Isfahan. According to IranWire sources, Mehrab's body was returned to the family after six days with a pledge for 'burial in silence.' He was buried on Thursday, January 15, 2026 (25 Dey 1404).

description.en: Melina Asadi, a 3-year-old Kurdish girl from Kermanshah, lost her life on the evening of January 8, 2026 (18 Dey 1404) on Taq-e Bostan Boulevard. According to those close to the family, Melina had gone out with her father for daily shopping when suddenly a group of protesters fleeing from officers reached that area. At that moment, Iranian government forces fired indiscriminately without any specific targeting, and pellet bullets struck the head and body of this young child, causing her death. According to informed sources and people close to the Asadi family, the regime attempted from the beginning to attribute Melina's killing to protesters and put pressure on the family to accept this fabricated narrative; a narrative that is in complete contradiction with existing evidence, eyewitness testimony, and statements from those close to the family.

links.title: Hengaw report on the killing of Melina Asadi

description.en: Moin Gholami, 32, was killed on January 10, 2026 during protests in Karaj after being shot directly by security forces. A friend of his told IranWire: âI have known Moin since childhood. His sister was my high school friend. Today, in a brief call, I learned that Moin was killed in Karaj.â According to this person close to Moin, he was an active protester in the Life Woman Freedom movement: âHe was always protesting. The last time I saw him was as a motorcycle courier in the street. In his stories, he tried to report government bloggers and influencers like Hamid Sepidnam, known as Mr. Tester, so that their pages would be shut down and they could not carry out whitewashing operations.â

description.en: Sanam Pourbabaei, a talented and hardworking violin instructor and musician, was killed on Thursday, January 8, 2026 (18 Dey 1404) in the vicinity of the Lahijan Governorate. She was originally from Siahkal and was buried in the Bogh'e Barfjan shrine in that county. Several reports from sources indicate that the manner of her killing was unusual, with the shooting in the governorate area carried out from a long distance.

description.en: Sara Behboudi, a 45-year-old protesting citizen residing in Rasht, was killed on Friday night, January 9, 2026 (19 Dey 1404) in this city by the suppression forces of the Islamic Republic regime. According to IranWire, she was killed by war ammunition. Sara was a mountaineer who had climbed high peaks including Mount Kamal at 3,700 meters altitude in the Sahand region of East Azerbaijan province and Mount Shah Moallem at 3,050 meters altitude in Gilan province.

links.title: IranWire Report on Sara Behboudi's Death

description.en: Vahid Arzanloo, father of three young children, was shot twice in the neck by security forces on January 8, 2026 (18 Dey 1404) in the Tehranpars area of Tehran while going to help his brother Hamid, and fell into a coma. He died in the hospital on January 17, 2026 (27 Dey 1404). According to sources close to the family, security agencies received 1.5 billion tomans from the family for the return of the two brothers' bodies and forced them to sign a pledge stating the cause of death as 'stroke.' Additionally, the condition for returning the bodies was the family's attendance at a government rally in Enghelab Square. Vahid left behind three young orphaned children.

links.title: Report on Hamid and Vahid Arzanloo's Deaths

description.en: Zahra Esmaili was killed on January 8, 2026 (18 Dey 1404) in Shiraz. According to eyewitness testimony from her daughter Parisa, motorcycle forces chanting 'Heydar, Heydar' first shattered her body with pellet bullets, then shot her in the head. Her daughter laid her on her legs as Zahra spoke her last word: 'Parisa...' before losing her life.

links.title: Eyewitness Testimony on Zahra Esmaili's Death

description.en: Mohammad Goli was killed in the Najaf Abad protests on January 8th. When he saw that the Najaf Abad police were shooting towards the people from the police station, he drove a fire truck to the front of the police station to protect the protesters. He was hit by more than 11 bullets and died on the spot.

description.en: Masoud was full of life. His kidney transplant was not successful, but he lived. His dream was to build a greenhouse and he was going to have another kidney transplant. But he also had other dreams, one of which was extinguished in January of this year.

description.fa:
محمدرضا نجفی تنها فرزند پسر خانواده و فرزند یکی از آسیب‌دیدگان جنگ ایران و عراق بوده است. او در محدوده روبه‌روی آبشار شهر شازند، از روبه‌رو هدف شلیک تیر جنگی قرار گرفته و راویان می‌گویند ضاربان او ماموران سپاه پاسداران بوده‌اند.
محمدرضا نجفی به‌عنوان راننده ماشین سنگین مشغول به کار بود و به گفته اطرافیان، علاقه‌ زیادی به موتور و موتورسواری داشت.
